meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be opposed or contrasted.
meanings.sent1: The opposability of the two arguments made it easy to see the differences.
meanings.sent2: The opposability of the two colors made the painting more interesting.
meanings.sent3: The opposability of the flavors in the dish created a unique taste.
meanings.sent4: The opposability of their opinions clashed like thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: The opposability of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to fit them together.

meanings.definition: The ability to be placed opposite or facing something else.
meanings.sent1: The opposability of the chairs allowed for flexible seating arrangements.
meanings.sent2: The opposability of the magnets made it easy to connect them.
meanings.sent3: The opposability of the socks in the drawer made it hard to find a matching pair.
meanings.sent4: The opposability of the mirrors created an illusion of endless reflections.
meanings.sent5: The opposability of the bookends kept the books neatly in place.
